Assigned Security Responsibility
ID: AS_ORG_001
Description: Designate a HIPAA Security Officer who is responsible for developing, implementing, and overseeing the organization's security policies and procedures as required by the HIPAA Security Rule.1 The Security Officer should have the authority and resources to fulfill these responsibilities.

Workforce Security

ID: AS_EMP_001Description: Implement policies and procedures to ensure that workforce members have appropriate access to ePHI based on their roles and responsibilities, adhering to the principle of least privilege.1 Access should be limited to the minimum necessary to perform assigned tasks.

Establish and implement workforce clearance procedures that define the process for granting access to ePHI, which may include background checks where appropriate for the role.4 These procedures should ensure that individuals granted access are trustworthy and have a legitimate need for the information.
These procedures should ensure that access to ePHI is promptly revoked.
This may involve physical or logical separation of systems and data.

Develop and implement a comprehensive HIPAA security awareness and training program for all workforce members, including management, that covers the requirements of the HIPAA Privacy, Security, and Breach Notification Rules.1 The program should be tailored to the roles and responsibilities of the workforce members.

This training should cover the organization's policies and procedures related to PHI.Expected Evidence: Records of initial HIPAA training completion for new employees, including dates and content covered.
This training should ensure that incidents are reported promptly and appropriately.
The agreement should specify the purposes for which the business associate can use and disclose PHI.Expected Evidence: Review of the BAA to confirm inclusion of permitted and required uses of PHI.
Users should only have access to the ePHI necessary to perform their duties.

Implement audit controls, which include hardware, software, and/or procedural mechanisms that record and examine activity in information systems containing or using electronic Protected Health Information (ePHI).7 These controls should log user access, changes to ePHI, and security-related events.

ID: TS_AUD_002Description: Establish procedures for the regular review and analysis of audit logs to identify any suspicious or unauthorized activity that may indicate a security incident or a violation of HIPAA policies.1Expected Evidence: Records of audit log reviews, including dates of review, individuals responsible, findings, and any follow-up actions taken.

ID: TS_AUD_003Description: Implement measures to protect audit logs from tampering or unauthorized modification to ensure their integrity and reliability as a record of system activity.43 Access to audit logs should be restricted to authorized personnel.

Facility Access Controls

ID: PS_FAC_001Description: Establish (and implement as needed) procedures that allow facility access in support of restoration of lost data under the disaster recovery plan and emergency mode operations plan in the event of an emergency.7 These procedures should ensure that authorized personnel can access necessary facilities during disruptions.
This plan should address physical barriers, monitoring systems, and personnel security.
This may involve using access cards, biometric scanners, or manual sign-in logs.
This may involve using certified data destruction services or physical destruction methods.

ID: EHR_API_003Description: Ensure that only authorized applications and users are granted access to specific EHR data and functionalities through APIs, based on the principle of least privilege.44 Access should be limited to what is necessary for the integration's purpose.

ID: REP_LOG_003Description: Establish and document clear procedures for the regular review and analysis of system logs to identify any suspicious activity, potential security incidents, or unauthorized access to ePHI.1 These procedures should specify the frequency of reviews and the personnel responsible.

Retention Periods

ID: REP_RET_001Description: Develop and implement a comprehensive policy on the retention of all records related to HIPAA compliance, ensuring adherence to mandated retention periods.6 This policy should cover various types of documentation, including policies and procedures, risk assessments, training records, audit logs, and Business Associate Agreements.
Maintain Business Associate Agreements (BAAs) in compliance with the HIPAA Security Rule, generally for at least six years after the termination of the agreement.7
